00059 /*===========================================================================*\
00060  *
00061  *      Many interesting problems can be mapped to graph models.
00062  *      A particular powerful representation, weighted control
00063  *      graph, is a good data structure for representing programs.
00064  *      G = (n, N, E), where
00065  *      n = a designated entry node,
00066  *      N = a set of nodes,
00067  *      E = a set of arcs connecting nodes.
00068  *
00069  *      Each node is identified by a unique node_id attribute
00070  *      within a graph. The node_type attribute can be used to
00071  *      represent "group" information, the "access privilege",
00072  *      the "device type", and ... etc, in many interesting
00073  *      problems. Each node has a node_weight which indicates
00074  *      the "importance" of the node, relative to other nodes
00075  *      in the graph. For example, when modeling a program, the
00076  *      node_weight attribute tells the invocation frequency of
00077  *      a function (or a basic block). In many applications, it
00078  *      is necessary to distinguish the set of incoming arcs and
00079  *      the set of outgoing arcs. To achieve high efficiency,
00080  *      two linear lists of arcs are provided (instead of one
00081  *      unified list). Finally the extension field allows the
00082  *      application designer to design a special work-space.
00083  *
00084  *      Each arc has a 'type' attribute which tells us the
00085  *      relation between the two connecting nodes. For example,
00086  *      in a control flow graph, the relation is the condition
00087  *      on which the transition is taken (case, true, false, ...etc).
00088  *      Each arc has a 'weight' attribute, which tells us the
00089  *      relative importance of the arc. The source and destination
00090  *      pointers point to the connecting nodes. Finally, an extension
00091  *      field is reserved for special application requirement.
00092  *
00093 \*===========================================================================*/
00094 #ifndef IMPACT_GRAPH_H
00095 #define IMPACT_GRAPH_H
00096 
00097 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00098 #include <config.h>
00099 
00100 #define MAX_GRAPH_SIZE  (8*1024)        /* max. # of nodes in a graph */
00101 
00102 /*
00103  *      The correct range of the (status) field is
00104  *      0<= status < RESERVED_STATUS_BITS
00105  *      The user must at all time make sure that the
00106  *      RESERVED_STATUS_BITS of the status fields are 
00107  *      all 0s. This bit is used for internal operations.
00108  */
00109 #define RESERVED_STATUS_BITS    0x40000000
00110 
00111 typedef void *_NodeExtension;
00112 
00113 typedef struct _Node
00114 {
00115   int id;                       /* node id */
00116   int type;                     /* the type of the node */
00117   int status;                   /* the status of the node */
00118   double weight;                /* the weight */
00119   struct _Arc *source;          /* incoming arcs */
00120   struct _Arc *destination;     /* outgoing arcs */
00121   struct _Node *next;           /* reserved: internal use only */
00122   _NodeExtension extension;     /* extension fields */
00123 }
00124 _Node, *Node;
00125 
00126 typedef void *_ArcExtension;
00127 
00128 typedef struct _Arc
00129 {
00130   int type;                     /* the type of the arc */
00131   double weight;                /* the arc weight */
00132   struct _Node *source;         /* the source node */
00133   struct _Node *destination;    /* the destination node */
00134   struct _Arc *next;            /* reserved: internal use only */
00135   _ArcExtension extension;      /* extension fields */
00136 }
00137 _Arc, *Arc;
00138 
00139 typedef void *_GraphExtension;
00140 
00141 typedef struct _FGraph
00142 {
00143   struct _Node *root;           /* the root of the graph */
00144   struct _Node *nodes;          /* all nodes in the graph */
00145   struct _FGraph *next;         /* reserved: internal use only */
00146   _GraphExtension extension;    /* extension fields */
00147 }
00148 _FGraph, *FGraph;
00149 
00150 /*
00151  *      It is recommanded that the following MACROs be
00152  *      used to address the components of the node and
00153  *      arc structures. This makes the program more
00154  *      understandable, especially when short variable
00155  *      names are used (e.g. x,n,y). It is very easy to
00156  *      confuse between the components of arcs and nodes.
00157  */
00158 #define isNil(n)                (n==0)
00159 #define nodeId(n)               n->id
00160 #define nodeType(n)             n->type
00161 #define nodeStatus(n)           n->status
00162 #define nodeWeight(n)           n->weight
00163 #define sourceArcs(n)           n->source
00164 #define destinationArcs(n)      n->destination
00165 #define nextNode(n)             n->next
00166 #define nodeExt(n)              n->extension
00167 #define arcType(a)              a->type
00168 #define arcWeight(a)            a->weight
00169 #define sourceNode(a)           a->source
00170 #define destinationNode(a)      a->destination
00171 #define nextArc(a)              a->next
00172 #define arcExt(a)               a->extension
00173

00175 extern "C"
00176 {
00177 #endif
00178 
00179 /* graph.c 
00180  *      A connection is uniquely defined by (src_node, dest_node, type)
00181  *      It is an error to make a connection twice.
00182  */
00183   extern Node NewNode (void);
00184   extern Node FreeNode (Node * node);
00185   extern Arc NewArc (void);
00186   extern Arc FreeArc (Arc * arc);
00187   extern void ConnectNodes (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int relation);
00188   extern void DisconnectNodes (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int relation);
00189   extern Arc FindSrcArc (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int type);
00190   extern Arc FindDestArc (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int type);
00191   extern void RemoveNodes (Node * node);
00192 
00193 /*
00194  *      The following functions modify the (status) field.
00195  *      MarkNodesZero() sets all status fileds to 0.
00196  *      VisitNodes() and VisitAllNodes() do not change the status fields.
00197  *      IsCyclic() changes the status fields to 1 or 2.
00198  */
00199   extern int MarkNodesZero (Node node);
00200   extern int MarkNodes (Node node, int mask, int mark);
00201   extern int VisitNodes (Node node, int mark, int (*fn) (Node));
00202   extern int VisitAllNodes (Node node, int (*fn) (Node));
00203   extern int IsCyclic (Node node);
00204 
00205 /*
00206  *      The following functions operate on a graph structure.
00207  */
00208   extern FGraph NewGraph (void);
00209   extern FGraph FreeGraph (FGraph * graph);
00210   extern void AddNode (FGraph graph, Node node);
00211   extern Node FindNode (FGraph graph, int node_id);
00212   extern Node DeleteNode (FGraph graph, int node_id);
00213 
00214 #ifdef __cplusplus
00215 }
00216 #endif
00217 
00218 #endif
